messages.message:
here's another instance (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/67981#issuecomment-2755475474) where someone updated a proto without running `make build-protos` :sweat: cc @Ashwin (previous instance last week (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C073F3T5KRQ/p1742485630078919))

could we please make sure to check this in code review? or add an automated linter check for this in CI :pray:

Can we generate the Python proto files at build time rather than check them in to Git? @sean.donohoe

(As we do for Go code)
would that make the `mypy` checks more difficult?
No, it shouldn't -- `mypy` would run on the generated files, too. Ideally, Bazel runs `mypy`

Some of the GRPC _service_ stubs for mypy need to be manually written right now, but the request types do not.

I think we can fix this by upgrading our `mypy` and/or `grpc` versions in Python-land.
